subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariadna arthuri Petrunkevitch, 1926 : 48
, figs 8‒10 (Immature holotype from Santa Maria Bay, Saint Thomas [18°21'52"N; 64°59'47"W], Virgin Islands, Lesser Antilles, deposited in Peabody Museum, not examined).— Petrunkevitch (1929: 59, fig. 41) .— Beatty (1970: 472, figs 8‒9, 26‒27, 32) .— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

Note. This species was identified based on the descriptions and illustrations of specimens identified by Beatty (1970) . The specimens examined in this study are identified as “J.A.B.”. after the collection number.

Material examined. UNITED STATES OF AMERICA :
Florida State: Monroe County :
Squirrel Key [ 24°40'38"N ; 81°37'23"W ], 1♀ ,
29.VIII.1967
, R. Silberglied leg. (
MCZ 46081
)
;
Squirrel Key , opposite E-1, under bark of red mangrove [ 24°40'38"N ; 81°37'23"W ], 1♀ ,
4.VII.1967
, R. Silberglied leg. ( MCZ 128432 ; J.A.B. ); Key E-2, east side of Upper Snipe Key , Lower Keys [ 24°40'40"N ; 81°39'09"W ], 1♀ ,
12.VI.1966
, D. Simberloff & E.O. Wilson leg. (
MCZ 46152
)
;
Big Pine Key [ 24°41'10"N ; 81°21'40"W ], 1♀ ,
29.XII.1956
, F. & C. Phillips leg. ( MCZ 128431 ; J.A.B. );

:

640m
( 20°27'33.5"N ; 75°32'06.1"W ), 1♀ ,
2.XI.2009

;
Santiago de Cuba

.

Diagnosis.
Ariadna arthuri
is similar to
A. obscura
,
A. tarsalis
,
A. multispinosa
,
A. reginae
n. sp.
and
A. aurea
n. sp.
due to the morphology of the male metatarsi I ( Figs 16C‒E , 32C‒E , 38C‒E , 54C‒E , 56C‒E ) and macrosetae pattern of the tibia I‒II of females, but differ by the presence of males with a sinuous metatarsi I, with two apophyses on the distal region, bearing thickened macrosetae ( Fig. 38C‒E ); females differ by the presence of the anterior receptaculum with a sinuous dorsal lobe and a expanded ventral lobe, mainly at the base ( Fig. 39C‒D ).
Variation. Female (n=10): Total length 4.08‒8.28; carapace 1.84‒3.76 long, 1.16‒2.4 wide; femur I 1.2‒2.6.
Distribution. USA ( Florida ), Virgin Islands and Cuba ( Fig. 68 ).
